Ok, so you're probably thinking, "goodness, this man has over 2000 hours in this game, it must be really good right?" well, you'd be mistaken. horribly mistaken. Where do I even start with DBD? This game is, as a whole, is a massive bug fest, that only gets worse with each update. With every bug the developers fix, they allow 2 more to make it into the game. That's not an exaggeration either. There are actually so many bugs in the game, that it's a running joke in the community at this point, and even the devs will joke about it. These are the people that make this game people, and they've actually acknowledged that it's such a mess, and there's really not much they can do, or are willing to do, short of an overhaul of the entire game, which would require them to re-code literally everything. And let me tell you, they aren't going to do that ever. Not because of the time it would take, but because its's not profitable. Which leads me to my second point, how much of a cash grab this game is. As of writing this, there are 20 killers, with the 21st on the PTB as we speak. 5 of said killers are free, and the rest are locked behind a pay wall. It costs, literally, quite well over $100 CAD to purchase all of the DLC in this game. "But Zach!" you may ask, "Isn't the best killer in the game (The nurse) free?" Yes my child, she is. But if you want good perks to stand a chance against actual decent team of survivors, you'll need to either cough up like 20 bucks, or hope to god you get lucky in the shrine of secrets and the exact perk, out of literal dozens of perks might I add, shows up that week. "Wow," you might say, "If the games that bad, then why the heck do you even play it, and how in gods name did you manage to play for 2000 hours? You're insane!" Yes, once again, you are correct, I am insane. That's why I'm writing this review, so I can save you the insanity of becoming addictive to this god forsaken game. This game, when things go right, is very fun and addictive to play. It's the best game in its genre, and it rewards skill and clever thinking, something that I enjoy. But good lord, it's quite rare that things do go right all the time. Whether you encounter a bug that makes you fall out of the map and get trapped in purgatory, you fly into literal space because you bounced off a rock wrong, or you literally lose access to your power and movement capabilities because god forbid, you hooked a survivor, this game can be a bloody nightmare. I've had a bug happen to me 3 times in one freaking day where I hooked a survivor as the Oni, and the game broke, my power was bugged and he was stuck on the hook mid animation. Even after the game ends, and the end game collapse triggers, the game continues. So you are either forced to DC, de-rank and lose your bloodpoints from that match, or hope to god the other guy DC's first. The devs said they fixed this. Multiple times in multiple different patches. But ask any Oni main and they'll tell you the hell that is the "no power bug". And that's the problem. In my opinion, the devs have showed time and time again that they're incredibly disconnected from the community that plays their game, and that they have little to no insight on how to properly balance a game. Clown has been consistently horrible for months upon months, but no, lets nerf hillbilly right? The literal definition of a "strong but fair killer". After the backlash, they reverted the changes to be minimal, but good lord, if someone isn't fired over those add-on change ideas, I'm gonna lose it. (I'm looking at you Almo, how in gods name are you head of balance? You should have been fired the day you made that "clown is underrated" comment.) And don't even get me started on MMR. The ONLY reason that was reverted was because new payers *cough cough* excuse me, new players we're refunding the game because they weren't really a fan of getting instantly deleted by a rank 1 nurse before 1 gen popped, and the marketing team freaked the hell out, and basically overrided the decision. In my opinion, they have lost all right to our trust on how to manage a game. Now, even after all that, if you've watched videos on the game and still think it looks fun, let me explain to you the worst part. The community. Good lord, the community of this game is the most toxic cesspool of negativity and just all around childishness I've ever seen. Survivors crying about tunneling, NOED, camping, and everything to do with not letting them, win, killers complaining about decisive strike unbreakable combo, "infinites" , body-blocking and anything to do with not letting them get a 4k. It's all there. Don't believe me? Check the forums. Click the first post on the front page, and you'll see what I mean. The comments will either be "killer is OP" or "survivor is OP". Now there are some great people in the community, Like Otzdarva, No0b3, OhTofu and Monto, (sorry if i forgot any other decent streamers) but for every nice and positive streamer, there's 10 that are seething with negativity. And its quite sad. This game is rated mature 17+ and yet the community is a group of little kids. And that, above all, is why I do not recommend this game.
O jogo requer muita prática, mas é prazeroso, divertido e desafiador.

Great game even without friends, but like most games. Even better with friends. Great community and honestly cross-play was needed, but they are some of the MOST TOXIC players. 

Pro:
- easy to dump hours into 
- great platform to make some friends that are not all about fps
- simple mechanics
- you can be a toxic killer towards console players
- cross-play

Con:
- still buggy 
- toxic console players

If you need a change of pace from all the battle royales and fps. This is the game.

I cannot recommend this game enough. It's well kept-up, the characters are all interesting and fun to play, and there's a lot to devour. While it can be a slog to grind for paywall content using in-game currency, all of the DLC content is relatively inexpensive and goes on sale frequently. Survivors are largely free-to-play, and even paywall perks can be accessed for free over time. I have yet to pay for a DLC that I do not enjoy! There's a space here both for tryhard players AND folks who just want a good time, and it's a blast to play with friends (or kill your friends).
The only issue is, the community can be very divisive and VERY salty. If you can keep a level head despite the tomfoolery, then this is the game for you. But beware if you tilt easy, because Dead By Daylight will tilt you off the face of the earth if you let it.

High tension. Playing the survivor is heart pounding, but I really enjoy playing The Huntress. I don't know why but she's just really fun. I guess I like that this is the kind of match based game that I can sit down and enjoy without too much of a time investment in one sitting and my enjoyment doesn't suffer for it.
